content.description:
The problem climbs a featured, overhung arete over a great landing.

Sit start with your left hand at the large hueco and your right hand bump on the arete. From there, ascend the arete using the bumps on the arete and the huecos on the face. At about the 3/4 mark, follow the sloping bumps onto the slab, and finish with a juggy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Crossroads.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand low in the divide on a good hold and a sandy, left hand sidepull. From there, ascend the short arete to jugs and a mantel finish.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Crossroads south face.

content.description:
Rippin' Lips climbs a very short overhung face with a good amount of tension.

Sit start low on the diagonal crack with a flipped left hand and a right hand fingerlock. From there, make a tense move to a left hand edge, walk the feet into position, dyno to the jug lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Crossroads.

content.description: Sit start matched on the arete. From there, follow the arete using a good edge on the face to reach a featured lip and a thoughtful mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a few rocks, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the cracked arete of Crossroads north face.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on the lip and your right hand compressing the opposite arete. From there, bump along the arete, gain a pair of edges, follow to the jugs above, and finish up the easy slab.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the south face overhang of Crossroads.
